description: Two storey side extension and part single, part two storey rear extension
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number SB/127/13 (Location Plan, Site Plan, Existing and Proposed Plans and Elevations received 25/6/13), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, & 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), SPD 4, policies 1.1, 1.2 & 4.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy LV 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (Draft 2013), policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended 2008), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, & 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), SPD 4, policies 1.1, 1.2 & 4.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 and 7B the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (Draft 2013), policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  Reason:	To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, & 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), SPD 4, policies 1.1, 1.2 and 4.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (Draft 2013), policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The extension hereby permitted shall only be used for domestic purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the dwellinghouse at number  127 Tentelow Lane, Southall and not for any separate residential use or for any industrial, commercial or business use.  Reason:	To ensure that the use of the extension does not, by reason of any other activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), SPD 4, policies 1.1, 1.2 & 4.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 and 7B the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (Draft 2013), policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Details of tree removal/tree retention and measures to ensure the protection of retained trees on the site to British Standard 2005:5837 including if necessary through appropriate  foundation design  shall all be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall thereafter be implemented only in accordance with the approved details unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To prevent material harm to trees in the interests of public safety in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, 5.5 and 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPD 4 and SPG 9, policies 1.1, 1.2 and 4.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012),, policies LV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (Draft 2013), policies 7.4-7.6 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
